intro: Ornithogalum pyrenaicum f. granatense, commonly known as the Granatense Star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
